items.title: Johan Camargo threw with a young Braves fan and Ozzie Albies said the kid's arm was better than his
items.summary: Camargo threw with a young fan in the stands

items.title: Springer adds to Hurricane Harvey relief efforts
items.summary: Following the aftermath of Hurricane Harvey's devastation, relief efforts for Houston and southeast Texas have helped raise money and spirits for the multitude of people affected. Astros outfielder George Springer's sister Nicole is one of many people who have sprung into action. She organized a collection of donations from their hometown of New Britain, CT.
items.content: Following the aftermath of Hurricane Harvey's devastation, relief efforts for Houston and southeast Texas have helped raise money and spirits for the multitude of people affected. Astros outfielder George Springer's sister Nicole is one of many people who have sprung into action. She organized a collection of donations from their hometown of New Britain, CT.

alternate.title: Springer adds to Hurricane Harvey relief efforts

items.title: Twins will be cautious with young Berrios
items.summary: Twins right-hander Jose Berrios already has thrown a career-high 175 2/3 innings between Triple-A and the Majors this season, and manager Paul Molitor said they'll be cautious with the 23-year-old down the stretch.
items.content: Twins right-hander Jose Berrios already has thrown a career-high 175 2/3 innings between Triple-A and the Majors this season, and manager Paul Molitor said they'll be cautious with the 23-year-old down the stretch.

alternate.title: Twins will be cautious with young Berrios

items.title: Lobaton relieved that ankle injury isn't serious
items.summary: Nationals catcher Jose Lobaton was relieved Friday afternoon at the condition of his left ankle a day after getting struck with an errant slider in the second inning of the Nats' 5-2 victory against the Braves on Thursday.
items.content: Nationals catcher Jose Lobaton was relieved Friday afternoon at the condition of his left ankle a day after getting struck with an errant slider in the second inning of the Nats' 5-2 victory against the Braves on Thursday.

alternate.title: Lobaton relieved that ankle injury isn't serious

items.title: Salvy going day to day with intercostal injury
items.summary: Royals catcher Salvador Perez, who was removed from Thursday night's game against the Indians after aggravating an intercostal strain, was not in the starting lineup on Friday, either.
items.content: Royals catcher Salvador Perez, who was removed from Thursday night's game against the Indians after aggravating an intercostal strain, was not in the starting lineup on Friday, either.

alternate.title: Salvy going day to day with intercostal injury
